item.title: SJW Coup Going Down at Fox News? " Alex Jones' Infowars: There's a war on for your mind!
item.description:
SJW Coup Going Down at Fox News? " Alex Jones' Infowars: There's a war on for your mind!

Form the New York Times: Roger Ailes's tenure as the head of Fox News appears to be over. Mr. Ailes and 21st Century Fox, Fox News's parent company, are in the advanced stages of discussions that would lead to his departure as chairman, Susan Estrich, one of Mr. Ailes's lawyers, said in an interview on Tuesday.

item.title: Justice Department sues to block Anthem acquisition of Cigna
item.description:
Justice Department sues to block Anthem acquisition of Cigna

The Justice Department on Thursday sued to block the $54 billion mega-merger between Anthem and Cigna, arguing it would eliminate competition "harming millions of American consumers, as well as doctors and hospitals." Anthem's acquisition of Cigna, which was proposed last year, would be the largest health insurance industry merger in history.

item.title: Police shoot unarmed black man on ground with his hands in the air
item.description:
Police shoot unarmed black man on ground with his hands in the air

A black man who was caring for an autistic man was shot by police in North Miami, while he was lying on the ground with his hands in the air. Cell phone footage of the incident shows Charles Kinsey, who is lying on the ground with his hands in the air, in the moments before he was shot by officers.

item.title: Facebook takes flight | Facebook 2026
item.description:
Facebook takes flight | Facebook 2026

At 2AM, in the dark morning hours of June 28th, Mark Zuckerberg woke up and got on a plane. He was traveling to an aviation testing facility in Yuma, AZ, where a small Facebook team had been working on a secret project.

item.title: Turkey air chief 'confesses' coup plot - BBC News
item.description:
Turkey air chief 'confesses' coup plot - BBC News

Turkish air force chief Akin Ozturk confesses to planning Friday's coup attempt in which at least 200 died - state media

item.title: Monsanto, America's Monster - disinformation
item.description:
Monsanto, America's Monster - disinformation

Last month, the University of San Francisco made an alarming discovery, that 93% of Americans tested had traces of a chemical called glyphosate in their urine. Last year, the World Health Organization deemed glyphosate a "possible carcinogen". Glyphosate is the main ingredient in biotech giant Monsanto's flagship product: Roundup, an herbicide sprayed all over almost every acre of food grown.

item.title: Freddie Gray case: Verdict expected for highest ranking officer
item.description:
Freddie Gray case: Verdict expected for highest ranking officer

Gray's death ushered in a resurgence of Black Lives Matter protests across the country. The recent deaths of Alton Sterling and Philando Castile have popularized the movement once again.

item.title: Cyborg Santos Injury: Updates on MMA Fighter's Head and Recovery
item.description:
Cyborg Santos Injury: Updates on MMA Fighter's Head and Recovery

Cristiane Justino, ex-wife of Evangelista Santos, revealed the 38-year-old mixed martial arts fighter suffered a gruesome head injury in his defeat Saturday to Michael Page at Bellator 158. Justino provided an update on Instagram (warning: graphic image): More to follow.

item.title: Bernie Sanders Sold Out. Why Are You Surprised? (Gonzo & Conjure '16) - disinformation
item.description:
Bernie Sanders Sold Out. Why Are You Surprised? (Gonzo & Conjure '16) - disinformation

"What we are dealing with now is nothing less than another Empire on the brink of collapse-more than likely of its own weight & twisted priorities. This process is already well underway. Everything Nixon stands for is doomed, now or later.

item.title: Washington, DC considers supplementing ambulances with Uber and other ride services
item.description:
Washington, DC considers supplementing ambulances with Uber and other ride services

Washington DC is considering utilizing drivers from Uber or similar services to help shift some of the lowest priority calls away from ambulances. According to NBC Washington 4, Washington, DC city emergency services are thinking outside the box when it comes to dealing with low-level emergency calls by utilizing third-party services such as Uber or local taxi companies to help ease the demand on the system.
